Topic.Title: NVDA 2012 performance rewards - 15% average based Wage increase for Executives

Message.Msg: Nvidia's management and most of engineering have been through a period of austerity to some extent -- I personally know folks who took pay cuts. I think Jensen is seeing prosperous times ahead, evidence $1B buyback and dividend. Pay increases are not out of line.

Message.Title: Nvidia in automotive - another unannounced win?
Message.Msg: Rumor - Nvidia is partnering with MS and will be providing the app processor for their newest SYNC platform. This reaffirms, I think, the ongoing relationship nvidia has with MS and expect more T4's in other upcoming MS branded products. This is contrary to how I originally viewed their relationship lately.

Topic.Title: Nvidia in automotive - another unannounced win?

Message.Msg: If that's a win from Ford, that"s great news. But frankly, MSFT as a partner has been a big disappointment for NVDA lately. I hope MS don't ef it up.

Message.Title: HP is working on a Tegra 4 powered tablet in addition to the low-end Slate 7
Message.Msg: SOURCE: christianpostDOTcom/news/hp-slate-7-tablet-launches-in-us-as-nexus-7-competitor-94872/ ""HP is also working on an Android tablet that will feature Nvidia's Tegra 4 processor. The chip was announced at this year's Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas.""

Topic.Title: HP is working on a Tegra 4 powered tablet in addition to the low-end Slate 7

Message.Msg: If this is true, the HP Tegra 4 tablet could be a high volume product. Despite recent setbacks, HP still has deep pocket and huge marketing presence.

Topic.Title: Nvidia in automotive - another unannounced win?

Message.Msg: Good point, but I think with the right application MS is 'okay'. Because Ford is ultimately delivering the this product within their cars, it has a better chance of being successful then anything basically designed and developed almost exclusively by MS. I think MS screwed up Surface by burning out the critical talent to develop the tablet/book and not keeping that talent once it was ready to be delivered to the public. With Ford really being the critical player, this could really fly imo.

Topic.Title: HP is working on a Tegra 4 powered tablet in addition to the low-end Slate 7

Message.Msg: HP learned their lesson from the 1st tablet launch. They are pricing the 7" tablet aggressively and when T4 arrive for them - it's going to do a lo better than Surface RT! MS keeps relearning old lessons and will continue to do so until Oldmer is out.

Topic.Title: Is there any synergy between INTC and NVDA ?

Message.Msg: Absolutely! Unfortunately there may be antitrust issues with the HPC part of it. Between INTC & NVDA they probably own 80% of the hardware going into a HPC.
